refnamediv.refpurpose: Append a new point into the acquisition

refsynopsisdiv.title: Calling Sequence
refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: btkAppendPoint(h, type, label, values, [residuals, [masks, [description]]]) points = btkAppendPoint(h, type, label, values, [residuals, [masks, [description]]]) [points, pointsInfo] = btkAppendPoint(h, type, label, values, [residuals, [masks, [description]]])

listitem.para: The handle used to represent an acquisition.
A non empty string containing the type of the point (Angle, Marker, Force, Moment, Power)
A non empty string to represent the label of the point.
A matrix (n,3) where n corresponds to the number of frames in the acquisition.
A matrix (n,1) corresponding to the residuals of the 3D reconstruction of the marker. Note: This parameter is an informational parameter and is not used in some commercial softwares.

A matrix (n,1) corresponding to the list of cameras used to reconstruct markers' positions. This list is represented as an integer corresponding to a conversion of a binary number. For example, the value 14 correspond to the mask 0b0001110 meaning that cameras #2, #3 and #4 was used to reconstruct the point. Note: This parameter is an informational parameter and is not used in some commercial software
A string containing the description of the point.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Insert or set a point into the acquisition.
The format of the outputs points and pointsInfo are structures presented in details in the function btkGetPoints.
The acquisition is represented by the handle h. This handle is obtained by the use of a btk* function.
